content:
DataGridTemplateColumn Class

Definition

Represents a DataGrid column that hosts template-specified content in its cells.

In this Article

public class DataGridTemplateColumn : System.Windows.Controls.DataGridColumn

Object

DependencyObject
DataGridColumn
DataGridTemplateColumn

Examples

The following example shows how to create a DataGridTemplateColumn. 

<Grid>
    <Grid.Resources>
        <!--DataTemplate for Published Date column defined in Grid.Resources.  PublishDate is a property on the ItemsSource of type DateTime -->
        <DataTemplate x:Key="DateTemplate" >
            <StackPanel Width="20" Height="30">
                <Border Background="LightBlue" BorderBrush="Black" BorderThickness="1">
                    <TextBlock Text="{Binding PublishDate, StringFormat={}{0:MMM}}" FontSize="8" HorizontalAlignment="Center" />
                </Border>
                <Border Background="White" BorderBrush="Black" BorderThickness="1">
                    <TextBlock Text="{Binding PublishDate, StringFormat={}{0:yyyy}}" FontSize="8" FontWeight="Bold" HorizontalAlignment="Center" />
                </Border>
            </StackPanel>
        </DataTemplate>
        <!--DataTemplate for the Published Date column when in edit mode. -->
        <DataTemplate x:Key="EditingDateTemplate">
            <DatePicker SelectedDate="{Binding PublishDate}"  />
        </DataTemplate>
    </Grid.Resources>
    <DataGrid Name="DG1" ItemsSource="{Binding}" AutoGenerateColumns="False" >
        <DataGrid.Columns>
            <!--Custom column that shows the published date-->
            <DataGridTemplateColumn Header="Publish Date" CellTemplate="{StaticResource DateTemplate}" CellEditingTemplate="{StaticResource EditingDateTemplate}" />
        </DataGrid.Columns>
    </DataGrid>
</Grid>

This snippet ID 1 is used in multiple files: /CS/window1.xaml, /xaml/window1.xaml. Rename the duplicate ID to make it unique, and update the reference to the snippet ID in the topic(s).

The following illustration shows the output from the previous XAML.

Remarks

The DataGridTemplateColumn type enables you to create your own column types by specifying the cell templates to use when displaying and editing values. To specify the template that is used to display the contents of a cell that is not in editing mode, set the CellTemplate property. To specify the template that is used to display the contents of a cell that is in editing mode, set the CellEditingTemplate property. For more information about templates, see Data Templating Overview and Styling and Templating.

For convenience, DataGrid provides the following pre-defined column types:

Column Type Data Display
DataGridHyperlinkColumn Use to display URI data.
DataGridComboBoxColumn Use to display enumeration data.
DataGridTextColumn Use to display text.
DataGridCheckBoxColumn Use to display Boolean data.

Properties

CellEditingTemplate

Gets or sets the template to use to display the contents of a cell that is in editing mode.

public System.Windows.DataTemplate CellEditingTemplate { get; set; }
Value
DataTemplate

The template that is used to display the contents of a cell that is in editing mode. The registered default is null. For information about what can influence the value, see DependencyProperty.

Remarks

The cell editing template defines how the content is displayed in the column cells when in editing mode. For more information about data templates, see Data Templating Overview and Styling and Templating.

To define the template for the cell that is not in editing mode, use the CellTemplate.

CellEditingTemplateSelector

Gets or sets the object that determines which template to use to display the contents of a cell that is in editing mode.

public System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector CellEditingTemplateSelector { get; set; }
Value
DataTemplateSelector

The object that determines which template to use to display the contents of a cell that is in editing mode. The registered default is null. For information about what can influence the value, see DependencyProperty.

CellTemplate

Gets or sets the template to use to display the contents of a cell that is not in editing mode.

public System.Windows.DataTemplate CellTemplate { get; set; }
Value
DataTemplate

The template to use to display the contents of a cell that is not in editing mode. The registered default is null. For information about what can influence the value, see DependencyProperty.

Remarks

The cell template defines how the content is displayed in the column cells. For more information about data templates, see Data Templating Overview and Styling and Templating.

To define the template for a cell that is in editing mode, use the CellEditingTemplate.

CellTemplateSelector

Gets or sets the object that determines which template to use to display the contents of a cell that is not in editing mode.

public System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector CellTemplateSelector { get; set; }
Value
DataTemplateSelector

The object that determines which template to use. The registered default is null. For information about what can influence the value, see DependencyProperty.

RefreshCellContent(FrameworkElement, String)

Refreshes the contents of a cell in the column in response to a template property value change.

protected override void RefreshCellContent (System.Windows.FrameworkElement element, string propertyName);
Parameters
element
FrameworkElement

The cell to update.

propertyName
String

The name of the column property that has changed.
